title: Pamphile's adventures with the wineskins can also be related to a rnyth of Inanna. When the former loves a Boeotian, she animates corpses which turn into wineskins, and flies off to her beloved as an owl (Met. IIl.xvii.3-xYiü.4; xxi). So when Inanna kills Bilulu and Girgire, the murderers of Dumuzi, she changes their corpses into wineskins, and either goes as a partridge or sends one to Dumuzi's mother ('The Myth of Inanna and Bilulu'
